Study_ID: EStudo da CBZ versus LEV (mudar depois)
Seizure_Reduction_Percentage: 91.8% (45/49) for CBZ group, 78% (39/50) for LEV group
Risk_of_Bias: Moderate - open label but randomized with computer-generated numbers
Control_Group_N: Not applicable - comparative study between two treatments
Comments: CBZ showed better seizure control trend compared to LEV but had more minor side effects. Cost was 3-5 times lower for CBZ compared to LEV.
Diagnostic_Criteria: Del Brutto diagnostic criteria for NCC, drug naïve patients with NCC presenting with seizures
Antiepileptic_Drug: Carbamazepine (4-6 mg/kg/day increased to 10 mg/kg/day) or Levetiracetam (10mg/kg/day increased to 20mg/kg/day)
Other_AE: CBZ: 34.6% (dizziness, drowsiness, skin rash, gait ataxia, weight gain); LEV: 4% (dizziness, drowsiness)
Other_Symptoms: None had encephalitis, raised intracranial pressure or focal deficits
Study_Design: Open labelled randomized comparative monotherapy study
